_header.purpose: Grafana home dashboard serving as the navigation hub for the observability stack
_header.scope: Default landing page with folder-organized navigation linking to Web and Observability dashboard folders
_header.overview: Provides a centralized navigation hub for the Grafana observability stack. Displays system health status panels and links to folder summary dashboards. Organized into two sections: Web Application (linking to web-summary) and Observability Stack (linking to obs-summary). Configured as the default home dashboard via organization preferences. Uses stat panels for quick health indicators and text panels with markdown links for dashboard navigation.
_header.dependencies: Grafana 11.4+, Mimir datasource for health metrics, Web and Observability folder dashboards for navigation links
_header.exports: Default home dashboard loaded on Grafana startup
_header.interfaces: Referenced by grafana_organization_preferences home_dashboard_uid as home
_header.related: web-summary.json, obs-summary.json, all dashboard files in Web and Observability folders
_header.implementation: Grafana dashboard JSON schema version 39 with stat and text panels for navigation

title: Durable Code - Observability Home
description: Navigation hub for all observability dashboards

options.content:
### Web Application Dashboards
Production app signals — golden signals, per-endpoint RED, frontend vitals, and traces.

- [Summary](/grafana/d/web-summary) - Essential golden signals overview
- [Latency](/grafana/d/web-latency) - Request latency breakdowns (p50/p95/p99)
- [Errors](/grafana/d/web-errors) - Error rate analysis with status codes
- [Traffic](/grafana/d/web-traffic) - Request rate and connections
- [Saturation](/grafana/d/web-saturation) - ECS CPU/Memory utilization
- [Traces](/grafana/d/web-traces) - Trace search, service graph, span analysis
- [RED](/grafana/d/web-red) - Per-endpoint Rate, Errors, Duration
- [Frontend](/grafana/d/web-frontend) - Core Web Vitals (LCP, INP, CLS)

### Observability Stack Dashboards
Monitoring infrastructure signals — EC2 resources, container metrics, and profiling.

- [Summary](/grafana/d/obs-summary) - Essential infrastructure signals
- [Saturation](/grafana/d/obs-saturation) - EC2 CPU/Memory/Load
- [USE](/grafana/d/obs-use) - Full USE method (Utilization, Saturation, Errors)
- [Profiling](/grafana/d/obs-profiling) - CPU/Memory flame graphs

### Explore
- [Metrics](/grafana/explore?orgId=1&left=%7B%22datasource%22:%22mimir%22%7D) - Ad-hoc metric queries
- [Logs](/grafana/explore?orgId=1&left=%7B%22datasource%22:%22loki%22%7D) - Log search and analysis
- [Traces](/grafana/explore?orgId=1&left=%7B%22datasource%22:%22tempo%22%7D) - Trace search by ID
- [Profiles](/grafana/explore?orgId=1&left=%7B%22datasource%22:%22pyroscope%22%7D) - Profile analysis
